content.title: Financial Assistance for Purchasing School Uniforms, Books and Notebooks from Class 1st to 12th for Children of Workers- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Purchasing School Uniforms, Books and Notebooks from Class 1st to 12th for Children of Workers' is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board (HLWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, one-time financial assistance is provided to the children (2 boys & 3 girls) of workers employed in industrial and commercial establishments of the state of Haryana at the time of admission to continue their studies. The Board provides assistance for the sons and daughters of registered workers for the purchase of school uniforms, books, stationery, and other educational materials, enabling them to continue their studies from 1st to 12th standard.
eligibility: The applicant should be employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana.
The worker should be registered with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board.
The monthly salary of the worker should not exceed ₹25,000/-.
The service period of the workers is fixed for two years.
The worker's children studying in Class I to Class XII are eligible for the scheme's benefits at the time of admission to continue their studies.
The scheme benefits are available to three girls and two boys per worker.
The name of the child/children should be mentioned on the Ration Card/ESI Card of the worker.
documents_required: ID Proof of worker issued by the organization
Continuing Study Certificate (Generated by the Principal/Headmaster of the concerned school)

faqs.question: What is the purpose of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The purpose is to assist children of registered workers in continuing their education from Class 1 to Class 12 by providing financial support for school-related expenses.

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of ₹3000/- is provided for children in Class 1 to 4, and ₹4000/- for children in Class 5 to 12 at the time of admission to continue their studies.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The workers employed in industrial or commercial establishments in Haryana, registered with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board, with a monthly salary not exceeding ₹25,000/- can avail the benefits under the scheme for their children to purchase school uniforms, books, etc.

faqs.question: How many children per worker can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Up to three girls and two boys per worker can benefit from this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the required service period for the worker to be eligible?
faqs.answer: The worker must have a service period of at least two years.

faqs.question: Are there any income limits for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, the worker’s monthly salary should not exceed ₹25,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the last date to apply for this scheme each year?
faqs.answer: The last date for submission of applications is 31st December of the respective session.

faqs.question: How can a worker register under the Haryana Labour Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: A worker can register by visiting the official website of the Labour Department Haryana at https://hrylabour.gov.in/.

faqs.question: How does one apply for the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Applications for the scheme benefits can be submitted through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Is the scheme available for both boys and girls?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme benefits are available for both boys and girls of the workers.

faqs.question: Can applications be submitted after the deadline?
faqs.answer: No, applications submitted after 31st December will not be considered.
